fullDescription.intro: This node is used for cross validation. The internal workflow provides input nodes for training, test data, and an output node that collects the results of the different iterations. The user must add at least a learner and its predictor to the internal workflow and add appropiate connections. The internal workflow is then executed as many times as iterations should be performed. In the end the two output ports contain the confusion matrix and a simple error rate.
fullDescription.option: The number of cross validation iterations that should be performed.
If checked, the partitions are sampled randomly from the input table, otherwise it is cut into consecutive pieces.
The name of the column with the class labels.

Performs a leave-one-out cross validation, i.e. there are as many iterations as data points and in each iteration another point's target value is predicted by using all remaining points as training set.

ports.dataIn: Any datatable with attributes and a class label
ports.dataOut: Input table with additional column containing prediction
